adjective.description: Lacking a skull or cranium; (formerly) specifically belonging to the subphylum Cephalochordata (formerly Acrania) of primitive vertebrates lacking braincases.

noun.description: An acraniate organism; especially a cephalochordate.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Canadian Journal. Either from a- + craniate, or from scientific Latin Acrania + -ate.
